alert.note: Alert for Grant (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 14 at 9:31PM CDT until further notice by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Iowa... Mississippi River at McGregor affecting Allamakee, Crawford, Clayton and Grant Counties. ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Iowa... Mississippi River at Guttenberg Dam 10 affecting Clayton and Grant Counties. .Warm temperatures this week have melted much of the regional snowpack. This snowmelt is routing into the Mississippi River. Rain this weekend is expected to further increase river flows. This additional rainfall and upstream inflow has increased the expected crests at McGregor between 18.5 to 20.5 feet around April 22-24 and at Guttenberg between 16.5 to 18.5 feet around April 22-24. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Guttenberg Dam 10. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 13.5 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning.
